data_facts_with_para.paragraph: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) has released its Q2 2025 vehicle delivery and production report. As per the report, the company delivered over 384,000 vehicles in the second quarter of 2025, while deploying 9.6 GWh in energy storage. Vehicle production also reached 410,244 units for the quarter.

facts.fact_content: Tesla delivered over 384,000 vehicles in Q2 2025.
Tesla deployed 9.6 GWh in energy storage in Q2 2025.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: Of the 410,244 vehicles produced during the quarter, 396,835 were Model 3 and Model Y units, while 13,409 were attributed to Tesla’s other models, which includes the Cybertruck and Model S/X variants. Deliveries followed a similar pattern, with 373,728 Model 3/Ys delivered and 10,394 from other models, totaling 384,122.

facts.fact_content: 396,835 of the 410,244 vehicles produced were Model 3 and Model Y units.
13,409 of the 410,244 vehicles produced were other models.
10,394 vehicles from other models were delivered.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) surged over four percent on Wednesday morning after the company reported better-than-expected deliveries. It was nearly right on consensus estimations, as Wall Street predicted the company would deliver 385,000 cars in Q2.

facts.fact_content: Tesla's stock surged over four percent after reporting better-than-expected deliveries.
Wall Street predicted Tesla would deliver 385,000 cars in Q2.

data_facts_with_para.paragraph: Tesla reported that it delivered 384,122 vehicles in Q2. Many, including those inside the Tesla community, were anticipating deliveries in the 340,000 to 360,000 range, while Wall Street seemed to get it just right.

facts.fact_content: Tesla deliveries were anticipated in the 340,000 to 360,000 range by many.
